polished_script:
HOOK: You're losing $2.3 million buyers because your MLS stops at the county line. [ON-SCREEN: Your MLS = Your Limit?]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Picture this: Retirees want to compare Phoenix, Boise, and Raleigh. [ON-SCREEN: 3 Cities, 1 Client] Investors need cap rates across three states. And you're stuck saying "let me refer you out" because you can't pull comps outside your market. [ON-SCREEN: "Let me refer you..."] You lose the client. Someone else closes the deal.
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what top agents figured out while you're waiting for NAR to fix it.

INSIGHT: Chris Linsell, real estate tech analyst, just called for a national MLS system. [ON-SCREEN: Chris Linsell, Tech Analyst] But smart agents aren't waiting. They're buying secondary MLS access in their top three referral markets for fifty bucks a month each. [ON-SCREEN: $50/month = Access] They're using Zillow's API to pull national comps in under sixty seconds. [ON-SCREEN: 60 Seconds = Nationwide Comps] Most importantly, they're staying the primary contact, not becoming the handoff guy. [ON-SCREEN: Primary Contact vs. Handoff]

REFRAME: Three agents in offices just like yours already have Phoenix access, Nashville access, Denver access. They're closing the deals you're referring out. This isn't a technology problem anymore ‚Äî it's a decision problem.

CTA: "What's the number one market you refer clients to ‚Äî drop it in the comments?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Stop losing buyers at your MLS boundary. Here's how top agents are building their own national access for $50/month. üè†üìç
HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #MLS #RealEstateAgent #PropertySearch #RealEstateTips
SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "This isn't a technology problem anymore ‚Äî it's a decision problem."
PERFORMANCE_NOTES: [1] Emphasize "$2.3 million" with slight pause after for impact [2] Speed up during the three-step process in INSIGHT to show momentum [3] Lean forward slightly on "decision problem" for conviction

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Pivoted from 'policy wish' to 'actionable workaround.' Replaced vague CTA ('what would your pipeline look like?') with 5-step process agents can execute before their next team meeting. Added concrete costs ($50/month MLS access), specific tools (Zillow API), and real numbers ($2.3M buyer, $18K vs $1.2K commission comparison) throughout.
_metadata.judge_note: This is a policy wish, not an actionable insight‚Äîpivot to what agents can do NOW with existing tools (Zillow API, referral networks, multi-MLS subscriptions) instead of waiting for NAR to fix it.
